lexUnit.name: empty.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: containing nothing; not filled or occupied.

sentence.text: She was moving about the room now , balancing painfully but stoically on her high heels , taking empty cups and plates from each of her guests with a gentle murmur for every one of them .
At three o'clock , when Biff 's flask was empty , he let Joy Prentice down from her stool and sent her into the scutching room .
The almost empty bottle of Scotch was in keeping with Moore , and so was one glass .
His glass , in any case , was empty and so I started towards him .
Smacking his lips he placed the empty glass down on the bar .
An empty stomach and the pain of her ankle had been too much for her .
I mean , neither of us had eaten since the early hours , and drinking on an empty stomach is dodgy .
Large gaps in its commercial life -- and empty buildings in many poor neighbourhoods -- show where most of its manufacturers cut and ran years ago .
Avoiding Renwick 's eyes , Moore handed over the folded sheet as he rose and headed quickly for the Scotch , empty glass in hand .
As the door of the empty box creaked open in the wind , Liz heard the phone ringing , ringing .
If pig butchers kept piggy banks , his must have been empty once in a while during this period …
Like a cruel joke , someone had tidily piled the crushed and empty drink cans in one comer : not a single full one remained .
There 's an underground tunnel that goes from here to an empty tomb in the churchyard .
His enormous arm went over Rory 's head , the empty pint pot hanging in the smoke above the counter .
The bed beside her was empty .
The barrel was nearly empty and I had to climb right inside to get my apple .
The Galaxy was n't empty !
The building stood empty for 25 years , and was nearly torn down .
The fridge is nearly empty . ”
My body felt empty and I was hot inside , like a fire .
